snippet: A man who was imprisoned for more than 20 years was first awarded $18.5 million, but a judge has ordered that amount reduced by more than $6 million.
abstract: Federal Judge Shira A Scheindlin reduces 2010 jury award to wrongly-convicted prisoner Alan Newton of New York City to $12 million from $18.5 million, citing precedent from other cases; Newton was exonerated of 1985 rape charge by DNA evidence.
lead_paragraph: A man who was imprisoned for more than 20 years was first awarded $18.5 million, but a judge has ordered that amount reduced by more than $6 million.

headline.main: Judge Reduces Man’s Wrongful Conviction Award to $12 Million
